intro: Reseda aucheri subsp. bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate eryngo, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It features basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, with flowering stems that are usually unbranched. The flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. The plant is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental.
